subject: Re: [junit] Why no errors in JUnit 4?
msgSnippet: I thought it gave a good starting place for looking for the problem. My thinking went along the lines of: What s wrong? -4 errors, 0 failures- Oh, something
messageBody:
I thought it gave a good starting place for looking for the problem.
My thinking went along the lines of:

"What's wrong?"

-4 errors, 0 failures-

"Oh, something I wasn't expecting. I'll look at config/environment stuff first"

or

"What's wrong?"

-0 errors, 4 failures-

"What code changed?"

-Kevin

On 8/23/05, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> That's interesting. I myself never really found it all that useful, nor
> that much of a distraction. What did you use it for? Did you fix
> errors before failures, or vice versa? Did you find one harder to fix
> than the other?
>
> David Saff
>
> Elliotte Harold wrote:
>
> > JUnit 4 seems to have removed the distinction between failures and
> > errors. What's the thinking behind this? I always found it to be a
> > useful distinction myself.
> >
> > --
